case_title: MUHAMMAD AYUB vs DIRECTOR AGRICULTURE, AZAD JAMMU AND KASHMIR and another
court: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondant: Director Agriculture, Azad Jammu and Kashmir

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Ayub
accussed_details.designation: Artist in Publicity Wing of Agriculture Department

complaint_summary: Muhammad Ayub was accused of misappropriating Rs. 81,458 while serving as an Accountant in the Agriculture Department.
investigation_summary: The appellant was convicted by the Special Judge, Anti-Corruption, Muzaffarabad, sentenced to two years imprisonment and fined Rs. 10,000. He appealed to the High Court, which acquitted him, citing lack of evidence and procedural irregularities.

key_points: Appellant was dismissed from service without departmental proceedings or show-cause notice.
Appellant was convicted by Anti-Corruption Judge but later acquitted by the High Court.
Dismissal order violated mandatory provisions of E&D Rules, specifically Rule 9.
High Court judgment exonerated appellant from charges of misappropriation.
Appeal deemed competent despite arguments of time-bar and procedural deficiencies.
judgment_summary.final_decision: Appellant reinstated with all back benefits and deemed to have been in service throughout.

punishment: Original conviction: 2 years imprisonment and Rs. 10,000 fine (overturned by High Court).
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal accepted; appellant reinstated with all back benefits.
legal_arguments: Dismissal without departmental proceedings violates E&D Rules.
Conviction overturned by High Court due to lack of evidence.
Mandatory issuance of show-cause notice under Rule 9 not followed.

witness_statement.Drawing and Disbursing Officer: Claimed responsibility for depositing the amount but implicated the appellant.

key_issues: Validity of dismissal without departmental inquiry.
Impact of High Court acquittal on departmental actions.

maxims.Nullity of void orders: Orders suffering jurisdictional defects are void ab initio.

legal_terms.E&D Rules: Efficiency and Discipline Rules governing civil servants.
legal_terms.Show-cause notice: Mandatory notice before dismissal under Rule 9.

words_and_phrases.Void ab initio: Invalid from the outset due to procedural defects.

summary_vector_notes: Muhammad Ayub, a civil servant, was dismissed following a conviction for misappropriation. The High Court acquitted him, citing lack of evidence and procedural irregularities. The Service Tribunal reinstated him, emphasizing violations of E&D Rules and procedural safeguards.
